item.title: uncommon is an uncommon word - or a short intro to tokenization
item.description: did you know that “uncommon” is an uncommon word? we can arrive at this conclusion from tokenizers! creating a tokenizer is the first step towards building a large language model (LLM). tokenizers create tokens that can, ideally, represent the smallest units of meaning in language. for example, the word “influx” can be broken down into two tokens, “in” and “flux”. the “in” token carries plenty of meaning, being used in the formation of other words, such as “incoming” for things that are coming in, into us.
